intro: Dipterostele frymirei, commonly known as the golden star fern, is a unique plant with a distinctive botanical structure. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its intricate, branched vascular system known as a dipterostele. The plant exhibits a rosette growth form with pinnate leaves that are often bright green and covered in fine, silky hairs. Its reproductive structures include sporangia that are clustered in sori on the underside of the fronds. This fern is native to tropical regions and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
